words.def: in a tight or constricted manner
(physics) electromagnetic radiation that can produce a visual sensation
closely constrained or constricted or constricting
the state of aggregation of soil and its condition for supporting plant growth
the handle of a sword or dagger
a coating of gold or of something that looks like gold
a combat between two mounted knights tilting against each other with blunted lances
(baseball) a successful stroke in an athletic contest (especially in baseball)
a person who is deemed to be despicable or contemptible
the humanistic study of a body of literature
either of two soft fleshy milk-secreting glandular organs on the chest of a woman
the branch of engineering that deals with the use of computers and telecommunications to retrieve and store and transmit information
a light strong grey lustrous corrosion-resistant metallic element used in strong lightweight alloys (as for airplane parts)
a soft silver-white univalent element of the alkali metal group
